data.description:
Why Stifel

Stifel strives for a culture that puts its clients and associates first: a culture where everyone belongs, everyone is welcome, and everyone contributes to the success of our clients, their careers, and the firm as a whole.

 

Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

What You'll Be Doing

Stifel's Technology Product Development department works to transform our digital technology for advisors in order to strengthen client bonds.

 

The Technology Product Development Analyst Intern will work as a member of Stifel's analysis team. The Intern will engage with development teams & product management to analyze, document, and understand business processes and procedures as well as support discovery or solutions for firm driven initiatives and development.

 

What We're Looking For

  • Develop an understanding of the Stifel business & data models and use that knowledge to optimize the relationship between the company and the customer.
  • Field inbound requests from business users and product management and refine requirements until a full understanding is reached on the process being analyzed.
  • Perform limited due diligence to ensure quality and accuracy.
  • Work according to standards and practices set by Product Management or senior team members.
  • Gain an understanding of company applications and business practices in the context of how they affect the customer and the business process.
  • Research best practices and supports developing the solutions and recommendations for the business areas as identified.

What You'll Bring

  • Basic understanding of financial industry terminology and concepts.
  • Ability to take a problem and research it from beginning to end creating detailed documentation.
  • Strong analytical skills focused on using logic, reasoning, and data to identify complex relationships as well as to research and discuss recommended uses.

Education & Experience

  • Pursuing a degree in Finance, Information Technology, Computer Science, or Business with at least one year of college completed preferred.
  • Experience with office productivity, reporting, and technical documentation software such as Excel, Powerpoint, and Google Drive applications preferred. 
  • Experience with databases and SQL preferred.

Systems & Technology

  • Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.

About Stifel

Stifel is more than 130 years old and still thinking like a start-up.  We are a global wealth management and investment banking firm serious about innovation and fresh ideas.  Built on a simple premise of safeguarding our clients’ money as if it were our own, coined by our namesake, Herman Stifel, our success is intimately tied to our commitment to helping families, companies, and municipalities find their own success.

 

While our headquarters is in St. Louis, we have offices in New York, San Francisco, Baltimore, London, Frankfurt, Toronto, and more than 400 other locations.  Stifel is home to approximately 9,000 individuals who are currently building their careers as financial advisors, research analysts, project managers, marketing specialists, developers, bankers, operations associates, among hundreds more.  Let’s talk about how you can find your place here at Stifel, where success meets success.

 

At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.

 

Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
